comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: @wangchongxuan: A subject term above indicates that it was taken in Karelia in Russia. See en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republic_of_Karelia

comment.author: 61518665@N00
comment._content: Karelia is the soul of Finland, taken by the Russians and never returned.

comment.author: 25068151@N02
comment._content: This is a surprising combination - the two men with P-G are wearing clothes from Georgia (or that part of the then Russian empire (and are not, I think, Cossacks) while the photograph subject info says this is Karelia, up near Finland.  The trees look rightf for that part of the world but it seems surprising to see two men in native dress photographed in a region far from their presumed home, at least at that time.
